column4: I'm having some trouble getting apache2-dev installed, I get the error apache2-threaded-dev: Depends: libaprutil1-dev but it is not going to be installed
trying to install the one that says "not going to be installed" always yields the real error
yeah it's a chain 'not going to be installed' until I get to libsqlite3-dev where I get: libsqlite3-dev: Depends: libsqlite3-0 (= 3.6.22-1) but 3.6.23.1-2 is to be installed
yeah was going to, but nearly 100 programs depend on it
my best recommendation is to build sqlite3 from source and install it
scratch that, 438 to remove (2 GB)
I try compiling it myself
once installed local version, you should be able to force dpkg to know its installed using equivs
alright, compiled and installed the latest version, what is the next step to mk dpkg see it?
you lost me there, I'll look at the docs
still isn't working, I created the equivs file, should I set the version number to what libsqlite3-dev is looking for?
yes
alright
ah, well apache2 is still complaining
you are a genius :) should I know anything down the line though? i.e. will it update properly etc.
no
blah figured that was too much to hope for
will I need to rebuild it then?
if they haven't fixed it by then I don't know if a rebuild will work anymore
so what should I look out for/do?
one of the apache devs?
